means: 强制(force的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: A stiff knee following surgery forced her to walk with a limp.
sentence.Network_cn: 手术后她的膝盖活动不便，走路时被迫跛行。

sentence.Network_en: He recounted how heavily armed soldiers forced him from the presidential palace.
sentence.Network_cn: 他讲述了自己是怎样被全副武装的士兵从总统官邸里赶出来的。

sentence.Network_en: English students are forced to learn too much too soon.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国学生被迫在极短的时间内学习太多的东西。

jx.jx_en_mean: a fast march by soldiers, typically over a long distance

entry.tran: 被迫的;强迫的;非自愿的
entry.def: A forced action is something that you do because someone else makes you do it.

example.ex: A system of forced labour was used on the cocoa plantations.
example.tran: 可可种植园中曾实行强迫劳役制。

entry.def: A forced action is something that you do because circumstances make it necessary.

example.ex: He made a forced landing on a highway.

entry.def: If you describe something as forced, you mean it does not happen naturally and easily.

example.ex: She called him darling. It sounded so forced.
example.tran: 她称他为亲爱的。听起来很不自然。

means.word_mean: 1. produced by or subjected to forcing;
3. made necessary by an unexpected situation or emergency;

Those with low self-esteem didn't feel better after the forced self-affirmation.
However,if your bond does not have features hat make it attractive to other investors, you may be forced to sell your bond at a discount i.

Precisely because they were working with old-fashioned machines, George Martin and his team of engineers were forced to apply every ounce of their creativity to solve the problems posed to them by Lennon and McCartney.
The publisher, fearful of being cheated, forced her to submit to his scholarly examination by a board of educated men, including the colonial governor.

sentences.en: A forced kindness deserves no thanks.
sentences.cn: 勉强的仁慈,不值得感谢。

sentences.en: After several reverses the enemy was forced to retreat.
sentences.cn: 几次失败后敌军被迫后撤。
